metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14553 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
gdImageClone in gd.c in libgd 2.1.0-rc2 through 2.2.5 has a NULL pointer dereference allowing attackers to crash an application via a specific function call sequence. Only affects PHP when linked with an external libgd (not bundled).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.11+esm1
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.11+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2 ccdm94> in doxygen, libgd files are under the libmscgen directory.

criterions.comment: doxygen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libgd2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.11+esm1').
